author: @hensteeth
text:
I just realized the G'Kar from "Babylon 5" must have been modeled, at least in part, on Palestine. His planet, Narn, had been colonized by another race, and recently won a fragile freedom. He was sort of ambassador and sort of terrorist, that was jailed. While in jail, he had an epiphany about a just world, and wrote what became a central text for his planet.

That whole series was full of observations about the human condition, also entertaining.
